tasks.instruction: Create updated Git instructions for the user who is working on Windows and encountering errors. Address the "remote origin already exists" error and help them continue the process to successfully push their code to GitHub.

Create a complete, copy-paste ready script for uploading the Raja Repair Cirebon application to GitHub from Windows CMD. The script should handle the current errors the user is facing with the "remote origin already exists" and provide clear, sequential commands without comments prefixed with # symbols. Make sure the script is in Indonesian and extremely clear for copying and pasting directly into CMD.

Create a step-by-step guide in Indonesian for deploying the Raja Repair Cirebon application to Netlify now that the code has been successfully pushed to GitHub. Include instructions for connecting GitHub to Netlify, configuring build settings, and setting up the custom domain.

Review the screenshot (Screenshot (315).png) showing the Netlify interface and provide specific guidance on the current step of the Netlify deployment process. Address any visible issues or next actions needed based on what's shown in the screenshot.

Analyze the command line output provided by the user to verify if the project has been successfully uploaded to GitHub. Provide clear confirmation if the repository exists and contains the code, or instructions to verify the status of the GitHub repository.
